title: The Lord in the Heart as a Witness | Sri Chanchalapathi Dasa
speaker: HG Chanchalapathi Dasa

segments.key_quote: Krishna is seated in the heart and he is watching.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of CCTV surveillance to explain that Krishna is always watching us from within our hearts.
segments.transcript: You go to a big store and there'll be CCTVs in different places. They'll put a board: "This area is under CCTV surveillance." That means they put a CCTV and they're informing you. Somebody could be watching or somebody is recording. And if we see such a board there, "This is a CCTV surveillance zone," we are careful. We become alert. We don't do some wrong things, right? In the Bhagavatam, it is said, Krishna is the witness of the innermost core of our heart. And the highest yogi is one who is devoted to Krishna in the innermost core of his eye. That is why in Bhakti, we cannot cheat at all.
